meanings.definition: a string or cord that is drawn through a hem or casing to tighten or close an opening
meanings.sent1: The drawstring on my hoodie came loose.
meanings.sent2: She tied the drawstring of the bag to keep it closed.
meanings.sent3: The drawstring on the pajama pants played a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like a drawstring, pulling her closer.
meanings.sent5: The drawstring, like a magic spell, sealed the treasure chest tightly.

meanings.definition: to tighten or close an opening by pulling a drawstring
meanings.sent1: I drawstring my backpack before heading out.
meanings.sent2: He quickly drawstrings his jacket against the cold wind.
meanings.sent3: The magician drawstrings the curtain with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: She drawstrings her heart to protect herself.
meanings.sent5: The drawstring of fate pulls us together in unexpected ways.
